moduslam.map_manager.map_factories.camera_pointcloud.depth_estimator module

Model for depth estimation using Hugging Face’s transformers library.

Authors: https://github.com/LiheYoung/Depth-Anything TODO: make it faster…

_create_pointcloud(pose: tuple[tuple[float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float], tuple[float, float, float, float]], tf: list[list[float]], values: tuple[Image, Image], camera_matrix: Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal[3]]) → Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal[4, 'N']][source]

Creates a pointcloud from the given image(s) and transforms it according to the camera pose and base -> camera transformation.

Parameters:

  • pose – pose SE(3).

  • tf – base -> camera transformation SE(3).

  • values – stereo images.

Returns:

Pointcloud array [4, N].

_create_points_map(vertex_elements_table: dict[CameraPose, deque[Element]]) → Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal['N', 3]][source]

Creates points map from the given “vertex -> elements” table.

Parameters:

vertex_elements_table – “vertex -> elements” table.

Returns:

Points map array [N,3].

Raises:

TypeError – if the sensor is not of type StereoCamera.

moduslam.map_manager.map_factories.camera_pointcloud.utils.get_points_and_pixels(depth_1: Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal['M', 'N']], depth_2: Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal['M', 'N']], keypoints1: Sequence[KeyPoint], keypoints2: Sequence[KeyPoint], matches: Sequence[DMatch], camera_matrix: Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal[3]]) → tuple[Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal['N', 3]], Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal['N', 2]]][source]

Gets 3D points and corresponding pixels for matched features of two images.

Parameters:

  • depth_1 – depth map of the first image.

  • depth_2 – depth map of the second image.

  • keypoints1 – keypoints from the first image.

  • keypoints2 – keypoints from the second image.

  • matches – matches between the keypoints.

  • camera_matrix – camera matrix.

Returns:

3D points. pixels: corresponding pixels.

Return type:

points

moduslam.map_manager.map_factories.camera_pointcloud.utils.compute_transformation(points: Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal['N', 3]], pixels: Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal['N', 3]], camera_matrix: Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal[3]], dist_coefficients: Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal['N']]) → Annotated[ndarray[Any, dtype[floating | integer]], Literal[4]][source]

Computes transformation between two sets of points and pixels.

Parameters:

  • points – 3D points.

  • pixels – corresponding pixels.

  • camera_matrix – camera matrix.

  • dist_coefficients – distortion coefficients.

Returns:

SE(3) transformation matrix.

Parameters:

  • camera_matrix – camera matrix.
